subject: Hi there, welcome to MongoDB! Letâ€™s get started.
body:
Here are a few resources to help you get started. 
Welcome to MongoDB 
Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four 
steps:
 * Create cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/deploy-free-tier-cluster/>
 * Add IP address to access list 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/security/add-ip-address-to-list/>
 * Create a user 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/create-mongodb-user-for-cluster/>
 * Connect to cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/connect-to-your-cluster/>
â€Š
If youâ€™re more of a visual learner, weâ€™ve put together a six-minute video 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas> that 
guides you through cluster setup.
 <https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas>
Next, you can start building. Populate your newly-created cluster with some of 
our sample datasets. These are great for testing and quick prototyping.
Get started

subject: Python toolkit: Get started with guides, videos, and courses
body:
Explore endless resources to jumpstart your progress.
 <https://www.mongodb.com/>
Hey EmailEssence,
Welcome to MongoDB Atlas, a developer data platform that provides an 
integrated suite of data and application infrastructure. Build for virtually 
any type of application with support in Atlas for transactional, full-text 
search, vector search, stream processing, and more.
Python resources for you
 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/python/quickstarts/>
Quickstarts <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/python/quickstarts/>
 New to building with MongoDB and Python? Check out our Quickstart guides for 
step-by-step instructions for your first Python project on MongoDB.
Getting Started with MongoDB Atlas and Python > 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/products/atlas/quickstart-mongodb-atlas-python/>
 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/python/tutorials/>â€Š

Ready to tackle more advanced Python use cases with MongoDB? Check out our 
tutorials.

<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/python/farm-stack-fastapi-react-mongodb/>

 Smart auto‑assign – when an issue is created without an assignee, automatically assign it to the right team member.

 Sync parent and child tasks – if a subtask moves to "In Progress" then move the parent issue to "In Progress" too.

 Auto-link related issues – keep your issues linked by auto‑linking issues based on the conditions you set.

Jira is even more powerful with your team 
 Stay aligned and move the work that matters forward.
 
 
 It's easier to get the work done as a team – getting started using Jira is no different! Invite your teammates to help bring your first pieces of work into Jira, set up a project, and maximize collaboration by having everyone on a single platform.

subject: Three easy steps to customize Jira
body:
Atlassian
 
 
https://emailessence.atlassian.net/jira/your-work 
 Make Jira your own 
 Three steps to keep your team on track
 
https://emailessence.atlassian.net/jira/your-work 
 What goals did you have for getting started with Jira when you signed up?
 
 Here are three key ways to configure your Jira project to match how your team gets work done.
 
 1ï¸âƒ£ 
 Configure issues. Customize your issues to your work! You can store a huge amount of information in the fields on a Jira issue, with both built‑in and custom fields.
 
 2ï¸âƒ£ 
 Configure workflows. How work gets done varies team by team, so set up the stages of your team's unique workflow in Jira.
 
 3ï¸âƒ£ 
 
 
Invite your team. Jira is even more powerful when you use it to collaborate and move work forward with others.

subject: Three ways to grow your Jira experience
body:
Atlassian
 
https://start.atlassian.com/ 
Get in‑context insights to uplevel your agile workflows 
 Plus, understanding and sharing the big picture has never been easier.
 
 
 Agile practices can increase delivery speed, expand collaboration, and foster the ability to adapt quickly – and when paired with Jira roadmaps and insights, you and your team will have a head‑start on building a strategy that sets you up for future success.

subject:
[Action Required] Mandatory multi-factor authentication for Google
 Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and Firebase console access
body:
2-Step Verification requirement starts May 12, 2025.
MY CONSOLE
Hello EmailEssence,
We're writing to inform you that starting May 12, 2025, you will be  
required to use multi-factor authentication (MFA), also known as 2-Step  
Verification (2SV), to access Google Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and  
Firebase console. You're receiving this notice because you have access to  
projects on Google Cloud.
We understand this change may require some configuration adjustments and  
have provided additional information below to assist you.
What you need to know
In November 2024, we announced that Google Cloud will be mandating MFA,  
also known as 2-Step Verification (2SV), for all users. This helps protect  
your account by requiring both a password and an additional form of  
verification, such as a phone, security key, or Google Authenticator code,  
when signing in.
Starting May 12, 2025, 2SV will be mandatory to access Google Cloud  
console, gcloud CLI, and Firebase console.
What you need to do
To ensure continued access to Google Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and  
Firebase console, you are required to turn on 2-Step Verification for your  
account from security.google.com.
Exclusions
Apps and workloads that are hosted on Google Cloud, including those that  
use Google APIs
Other services, like Google Photos, YouTube, and Google Workspace  
(including Gmail, Google Sheets, and Google Slides) are not impacted by  
this requirement
We're here to help
For more information please refer to the multi-factor authentication  
requirement documentation If you have questions or need assistance, please  
contact Google Cloud Customer Care.
Thanks for choosing Google Cloud.
â€” The Google Cloud Team

SUPPORT
